education.school: Emory University, Emory College of Arts and Sciences
education.degree: Bachelor of Science in Quantitative Sciences: Informatics / Minor in Spanish
details: Relevant Courses: ML, AI, Prob. & Stats, Stat. Computing, DB Sys., Regression Analysis, Stat. Computing w/ Python & R

experience.position: QTM Data Science for Social Good Practicum Fellowship
description: Forecasted population growth until 2050 utilizing Python and R, analyzing migration trends with Census, ACS, and Tax data to aid ARC in efficient fund distribution across Metro Atlanta's 11 counties.
Improved current forecasting model accuracy by 60%, identifying proxies that significantly enhanced model performance.
Utilized Python, R, Excel, GCP for data collection, visualization, analysis, and linear regression.

experience.company: Better Business Bureau of North Georgia (BBB)
description: Investigated membership trends using SQL and R, pitching insights with Tableau visualizations to increase retention rate, reducing customer and membership churn by ~6%.
Employed SQL, R, Excel, Tableau, ggplot2, dplyr for data visualization, analysis, and business intelligence.

projects.name: Research: Gathering Expert Opinions for Poverty-Alleviation
description: Developed statistical tools to compile expert opinions from academic, non-profit, and government sectors for the Gates Foundation's social investment plans, gathering 3000+ NGO information in Bangladesh, Pakistan, and India.

projects.name: Machine Learning: Cyber Harassment Detection
description: Preprocessed 48000+ text values from Kaggle, training and hyperparameter tuning models for binary classification of cyberbullying to determine the most effective machine learning algorithm for cyber harassment detection.
Achieved 99% accuracies for BERT-base models with great precision and recall, justifying models' effectiveness.

projects.name: Game Development: Poro Party (watch the trailer here!)
description: Created a multiplayer (unlimited players) web-based party-style game with cute cat characters, physics, mini-games, and music using web sockets and Phaser3 HTML game framework for fun anywhere.

projects.name: Data Analysis: DataFest Hackathon 2023 Best Insight Award
description: Explored the American Bar Association's Free Legal Answers client categorization system, resolving inefficiency of pro bono legal expert availability and reducing overall time, improving website categorization efficiency by 40%.

extracurriculars.organization: QTM Ambassador • Department of Quantitative Theory & Methods (QTM), Emory University
description: Mentored over 300+ undergrad QTM students on classes and guided their educational and professional tracks.
Represented the department, moderated and hosted events for undergrad/grad QTM students, alumni, and advisory board.

extracurriculars.organization: Leadership Experience Advising Program (LEAP) Chair • Asian Student Organization
description: Directed weekly LEAP meetings for underclassmen, engaging dialogue on Asian and Asian American issues.
Spearheaded Asian cultural events and orchestrated workshops for Emory University and other Georgia colleges.
Pioneered a workspace for students to work on robotics projects and build/train for VEX U Robotics competitions.
Recruited 200+ members and hosted workshops on engineering principles, hands-on building, and programming.
